Text.Page:
Mission Orders

Bruke has issued an execution order for the traitor, Jelena. He demands that find Jelena and bring her head to him at once.

You heed the call of the justicar's orders and set off for the town of Popolion to find Prefect Bruke. Instead of welcoming you, he interrogated you and asked what you had been up to lately.

Not satisfied with your performance, Bruke was firmly convinced that you must have had a helper, and he ordered that this helper also be brought to him. Following Jelena's escape, Bruke suspects you of having helped a wanted criminal, which made him furious.

He asked you to report to Commander Samael and inform him of Jelena's escape. Samael reprimanded you but could do nothing but turn a blind eye to your services in Poporia.

What? Bruke issued an execution order? On me? What a...charmer. "Bring me her head?" Who talks like that?

Believe me, I'm no traitor. I wish there was time to explain. Suffice it to say, justicars and rangers don't get along."What will you do?"

What can I do? Run, obviously.

Tell your superiors you couldn't find me. You won't even have to lie. Just close your eyes for the next five seconds.

Until we meet again, and you can bet we'll meet again.
What? You let her get away? You incompetent fool! I don't care what you did in Sinestral Manor, this will stain your career as a soldier forever!<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I can explain..."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

I find it hard to believe she escaped without a trace. I think you're lying—I can see it in your eyes. My report will reflect that.

Well, General Samael's problem now. Report to him immediately. Once he reads my report, you'll be lucky if you're not locked up as a traitor.

I just read Bruke's report, . It says you let a known traitor escape.

On the other hand, it seems you were also instrumental in halting the instability there. "Yes sir."

How do I make sure you get what's coming to you? Decisions, decisions. Well, you fulfilled your orders. That will have to do for now. In the future, however, if Bruke tells you to jump, you ask how high—and then jump even higher.

Dismissed.
